Category.Name: Root
Category.ToolTip: eraser - Device Description File

Category.Name: deviceInformation
Category.ToolTip: Description of the camera

StringReg.Name: DeviceVersion
StringReg.Description: Displays the device version. This tag will also highlight if the firmware is a beta or custom design.

StringReg.Name: DeviceManufacturerInfo
StringReg.Description: This feature provides extended manufacturer information about the device.

StringReg.Name: deviceManufacturerPartNumber
StringReg.Description: This feature provides extended manufacturer part number information about the device.

StringReg.Name: DeviceFirmwareVersion
StringReg.Description: Displays the currently loaded firmware version number. Firmware files have a unique number and have the .cbf file extension.

String.Name: DeviceSerialNumber
String.Description: Displays the device’s factory set 8-digit serial number.

StringReg.Name: DeviceID
StringReg.Description: Displays the device’s factory set serial number.

Integer.Name: deviceMacAddress
Integer.Description: Displays the unique MAC (Media Access Control) address of the Device.

Enumeration.Name: deviceAcquisitionType
Enumeration.Description: Displays the Device Acquisition Type of the product.

EnumEntry.Name: Sensor
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The device gets its data directly from a sensor.
EnumEntry.Description: The device gets its data directly from a sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: GigEVision
EnumEntry.Description: GigE Vision

StringReg.Name: DeviceUserID
StringReg.Description: Feature to store a user-programmable identifier of up to 15 characters. The default factory setting is the camera serial number.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetDefault
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specify the camera configuration set to load and make active on camera power-up or reset
Enumeration.Description: Specify the camera configuration set to load and make active on camera power-up or reset. The camera configuration sets are stored in camera non volatile memory.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Factory Setting values as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 1
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 1 as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 2
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 2 as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 3
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 3 as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet4
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 4
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 4 as the Power-up Configuration.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetDefaultSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specify the camera configuration set to load and make active on camera power-up or reset
Enumeration.Description: Specify the camera configuration set to load and make active on camera power-up or reset. The camera configuration sets are stored in camera non volatile memory.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Factory Setting values as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 1
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 1 as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 2
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 2 as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 3
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 3 as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet4
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 4
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 4 as the Power-up Configuration.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the camera configuration set to load feature settings from or save current feature settings to. The Factory set contains default camera feature settings. User camera configuration sets contain feature settings previously saved by the user.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.Description: Select the default camera feature settings saved by the Factory.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.Description: Select the User defined Configuration space UserSet1 to save to or load from features settings previously saved by the user.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.Description: Select the User defined Configuration space UserSet2 to save to or load from features settings previously saved by the user.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet3
EnumEntry.Description: Select the User defined Configuration space UserSet3 to save to or load from features settings previously saved by the user.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet4
EnumEntry.Description: Select the User defined Configuration space UserSet4 to save to or load from features settings previously saved by the user.

Command.Name: UserSetLoad
Command.ToolTip: Load the currently selected user camera configuration set
Command.Description: Loads the camera configuration set, specified by the User Set Selector feature, to the camera and makes it active.

Command.Name: UserSetSave
Command.Description: Saves the current camera configuration to the user set specified by the User Set Selector feature. The user sets are located on the camera in non volatile memory.

EnumEntry.Name: LoadBusyError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The camera is busy and cannot perform the action

EnumEntry.Name: LoadMemoryError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Not enough memory to load set

EnumEntry.Name: LoadInvalidSetError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: At least one register could not be restored properly

EnumEntry.Name: LoadResourceManagerError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: An internal error happened related to the resource manager.

EnumEntry.Name: SaveBusyError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The camera is busy and cannot perform the action

EnumEntry.Name: SaveMemoryError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Camera ran out of memory while saving set

EnumEntry.Name: SaveInvalidSetError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: An invalid user set was requested

EnumEntry.Name: SaveResourceManagerError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: An internal error happened related to the resource manager.

Integer.Name: deviceDFNCVersionMajor
Integer.Description: Major revision of Dalsa Feature Naming Convention which was used to create the device's XML.

Integer.Name: deviceDFNCVersionMinor
Integer.Description: Minor revision of Dalsa Feature Naming Convention which was used to create the device's XML.

Integer.Name: DeviceSFNCVersionMajor
Integer.Description: Major Version of the Genicam Standard Features Naming Convention which was used to create the device's XML.

Integer.Name: DeviceSFNCVersionMinor
Integer.Description: Minor Version of the Genicam Standard Features Naming Convention which was used to create the device's XML.

Integer.Name: DeviceSFNCVersionSubMinor
Integer.Description: SubMinor Version of the Genicam Standard Features Naming Convention which was used to create the device's XML.

Command.Name: deviceBIST
Command.Description: Command to perform an internal test which will determine the device status.

Enumeration.Name: deviceBISTStatus
Enumeration.Description: Return the status of the device Built-In Self test. Possible return values are device-specific.

EnumEntry.Name: Passed
EnumEntry.Description: No failure detected

EnumEntry.Name: FirmwareUpdateFailure
EnumEntry.Description: Last firmware update operation failed

EnumEntry.Name: FPGA_CRC_Failure
EnumEntry.Description: FPGA Cyclic Redundancy Check Failed

EnumEntry.Name: Unexpected_Error
EnumEntry.Description: Switched to recovery mode due to unexpected software error.

Integer.Name: deviceBISTStatusAll
Integer.ToolTip: Device Built-In Self Test Status All
Integer.Description: Return the status of the device Built-In Self Test as a bitfield. The meaning for each bit is device-specific.
Integer.DisplayName: Device Built-In Self Test Status All

Enumeration.Name: sensorStatus
Enumeration.Description: Sensor Status during initialization. Possible return values are device-specific.

EnumEntry.Name: statusOK
EnumEntry.Description: No error detected

EnumEntry.Name: statusError
EnumEntry.Description: Sensor Sync Failure happened

Command.Name: DeviceReset
Command.Description: Resets the device to its power up state.

Integer.Name: deviceCalibrationDateRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Date when the camera was calibrated
Integer.Description: Date when the camera was calibrated

Enumeration.Name: DeviceTemperatureSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Select the source where the temperature is read.
Enumeration.Description: Select the source where the temperature is read.

Float.Name: DeviceTemperature
Float.ToolTip: The temperature of the selected source in degrees Celcius
Float.Description: The temperature of the selected source in degrees Celcius

Enumeration.Name: OverheatedStatus
Enumeration.Description: overheatedStatus

EnumEntry.Name: OK
EnumEntry.Description: Normal

EnumEntry.Name: Overheated
EnumEntry.Description: Over heated

Category.Name: deviceSensorControl
Category.ToolTip: Category related to the sensor functionality and related features

Enumeration.Name: DeviceScanType
Enumeration.Description: Scan type of the sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: Linescan
EnumEntry.Description: 1D linescan sensor

Enumeration.Name: sensorColorType
Enumeration.Description: Defines the camera sensor color type.

EnumEntry.Name: Monochrome
EnumEntry.Description: Sensor color type is monochrome.

EnumEntry.Name: CFA_Bayer
EnumEntry.Description: Sensor color type is Bayer Color Filter Array (CFA)

EnumEntry.Name: CFA_RBGG
EnumEntry.Description: The sensor is a RBGG (Red, Blue, Green, Green) Color Filter Array (CFA) sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: CFA_BRGG
EnumEntry.Description: The sensor is a BRGG (Blue, Red, Green, Green) Color Filter Array (CFA) sensor.

Integer.Name: SensorWidth
Integer.Description: Defines the sensor width in active pixels

Integer.Name: SensorHeight
Integer.Description: Defines the sensor height in active lines

Enumeration.Name: pixelSizeInput
Enumeration.Description: Size of the image input pixels, in bits per pixel.

EnumEntry.Name: Bpp8
EnumEntry.Description: Image format with 8 bits per pixel.

EnumEntry.Name: Bpp10
EnumEntry.Description: Image format with 10 bits per pixel.

EnumEntry.Name: Bpp12
EnumEntry.Description: Image format with 12 bits per pixel.

EnumEntry.Name: Bpp14
EnumEntry.Description: Image format with 14 bits per pixel.

EnumEntry.Name: Bpp16
EnumEntry.Description: Image format with 16 bits per pixel.

Float.Name: AcquisitionLineRate
Float.Description: Specifies the camera internal line rate, in Hz.

Integer.Name: AcquisitionLineRateRaw
Integer.Description: Controls the desired line rate of the camera in .001 Hz.

Enumeration.Name: ExposureMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Set the camera exposure operation mode.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the operation mode for the camera’s exposure (or electronic shutter).

EnumEntry.Name: Timed
EnumEntry.Description: The exposure duration time is set using the Exposure Time feature and the exposure starts with a LineStart event.

EnumEntry.Name: TriggerWidth
EnumEntry.Description: Uses the width of the trigger signal pulse to control the exposure duration. Use the Trigger Activation feature to set the polarity of the trigger. The Trigger Width setting is applicable when the LineStart trigger is enabled and a signal is selected as trigger source.

Float.Name: ExposureTime
Float.Description: Sets the exposure time (in microseconds) when the Exposure Mode feature is set to Timed.

Float.Name: exposureDelay
Float.Description: Specifies the delay in microseconds (µs) to apply after the LineStart event before starting the ExposureStart event.

Enumeration.Name: GainSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects which gain is controlled when adjusting gain features.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalAll
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Apply a digital gain adjustment to the entire image.
EnumEntry.Description: Apply a digital gain adjustment to the entire image.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalRed
EnumEntry.Description: Apply a digital gain adjustment to the red channel only.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalGreen
EnumEntry.Description: Apply a digital gain adjustment to the green channel only.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalBlue
EnumEntry.Description: Apply a digital gain adjustment to the blue channel only.

Float.Name: Gain
Float.Description: Sets the selected gain as an amplification factor applied to the image.

Boolean.Name: Gain_OverDrive
Boolean.ToolTip: Allow the higher maximum gain limit
Boolean.Description: Set the capability to allow the higher maximum gain limit.

Enumeration.Name: BlackLevelSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which tap is controlled by BlackLevel feature
Enumeration.Description: Selects which tap is controlled by BlackLevel feature.

Integer.Name: BlackLevelRaw
Integer.Description: Black level (offset) raw.

Float.Name: sensorLineSpatialCorrection
Float.Description: Set the number of lines of delay between color planes that are output from the sensor for Spatial Correction.

Enumeration.Name: sensorScanDirection
Enumeration.Description: Controls the sensor scan direction.

EnumEntry.Name: Forward
EnumEntry.Description: Internal Forward: The sensor outputs from top to bottom of the sensor line.

EnumEntry.Name: Reverse
EnumEntry.Description: Internal Reverse: The sensor outputs from bottom to top of the sensor line.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.Description: External: The sensor outputs direction is controlled by Line1 level.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.Description: External: The sensor outputs direction is controlled by Line2 level.

EnumEntry.Name: Line3
EnumEntry.Description: External: The sensor outputs direction is controlled by Line3 level.

EnumEntry.Name: Line4
EnumEntry.Description: External: The sensor outputs direction is controlled by Line4 level.

Enumeration.Name: imageDistortionCorrectionParallaxCorrectionSelector
Enumeration.Description: Select Parallax Correction either red_blue line or green line

Converter.Name: imageDistortionParallaxCorrectionPixelStretch
Converter.Description: Set Parallax Correction value of either red_blue or green

Category.Name: DigitalIOControl
Category.ToolTip: Category relating to camera Input and Output signals

Command.Name: TriggerSoftware
Command.Description: Activates a software trigger.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which type of trigger to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which type of trigger to configure with the various Trigger features.

EnumEntry.Name: LineStart
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger starting the capture of a single line.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger starting the capture of a single frame. Frame size is determined by image format feature “Height”.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameBurstStart
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger to capture multiple frames. The number of frames is specified by the triggerFrameCount feature.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameActive
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger controlling the frame(s) duration. One trigger can start many frames if the duration exceeds the size of one frame.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameBurstActive
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger controlling the frame(s) duration. One trigger can start many frames if the duration exceeds the size of one frame. The maximum number of frame in a burst specified by the triggerFrameCount feature.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerMode
Enumeration.Description: Controls the enable state of the selected trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: The selected trigger is turned off.

EnumEntry.Name: On
EnumEntry.Description: The selected trigger is active.

Integer.Name: triggerFrameCount
Integer.Description: Sets the maximum number of frames to acquire when a valid trigger is received. This feature is available when the Trigger Selector is set to Burst Trigger.

Integer.Name: triggerLineCount
Integer.Description: Sets the number of lines to acquire when a valid line trigger pulse is received.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerSource
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the internal signal or physical input line to use as the trigger source. The selected trigger must have its TriggerMode set to ON.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.Description: Select Line 1 (and associated I/O control block) to use as the external trigger source. See LineSelector feature for a complete list.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.Description: Select Line 2 (and associated I/O control block) to use as the external trigger source. See LineSelector feature for a complete list.

EnumEntry.Name: Line3
EnumEntry.Description: Select Line 3 (and associated I/O control block) to use as the external trigger source. See LineSelector feature for a complete list.

EnumEntry.Name: Line4
EnumEntry.Description: Select Line 4 (and associated I/O control block) to use as the external trigger source. See LineSelector feature for a complete list.

EnumEntry.Name: rotaryEncoder1
EnumEntry.Description: Select Rotary Encoder to use as the external line trigger source.

EnumEntry.Name: Software
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger command source is only generated by software using the Trigger Software command.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1End
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Timer1End Event as the internal trigger source.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer2End
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Timer2End Event as the internal trigger source.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1End
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Counter1End Event as the internal trigger source.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter2End
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Counter2End Event as the internal trigger source.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1Active
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Timer1Active signal as the internal trigger source.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer2Active
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Timer2Active signal as the internal trigger source.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1Active
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Counter1Active signal as the internal trigger source.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter2Active
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Counter1Active signal as the internal trigger source.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: The transition of the Input Line of the selected trigger source.
Enumeration.Description: Select the activation mode for the selected Input Line trigger source. This is applicable only for external line input lines.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the line source signal (after being process by the line inverter feature).

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the line source signal (after being process by the line inverter feature).

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger is considered valid on any edge (falling or rising) of the line source signal (after being process by the line inverter feature).

EnumEntry.Name: LevelHigh
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Trigger is active on a high signal
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is high.

EnumEntry.Name: LevelLow
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Trigger is active on a low signal
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is low.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerOverlap
Enumeration.Description: Specifies if a trigger overlap is permitted with the Active Frame or Active Line signal. This defines if a new valid trigger will be accepted (or latched) for a new frame or line.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: No trigger overlap is permitted.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadOut
EnumEntry.Description: Trigger is accepted immediately after the exposure period (readout).

EnumEntry.Name: previousLine
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Trigger are valid during previous line
EnumEntry.Description: Trigger is accepted (latched) at any time during the capture of the previous line.

Float.Name: TriggerDelay
Float.Description: Only frame triggers can be delayed. Specifies the delay to apply after receiving the trigger and before activating triggerEvent. The delay can be set in microseconds or in line trigger signals. The delayer can buffer and apply the specified delay to a maximum of 128 frame trigger pulses simultaneously. Any additional triggers will be lost if the trigger delayer buffer is full.

Enumeration.Name: triggerDelaySource
Enumeration.Description: Sets the event that increments the trigger delay counter

EnumEntry.Name: InternalClock
EnumEntry.Description: The delay counter increments on each microsecond tick of the device internal Clock.

EnumEntry.Name: lineTriggerSignal
EnumEntry.Description: The delay counter increments on each pulse received by the line trigger module. The delay counter increments even if the pulse is rejected by the line trigger module.

Float.Name: lineTriggerInputFrequency
Float.Description: Current line frequency measured by the camera.

Enumeration.Name: rotaryEncoderOutputMode
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the conditions for the Rotary Encoder interface to generate a valid Encoder output signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Position
EnumEntry.Description: Triggers are generated at all new position increments in the selected direction. If the encoder reverses no trigger events are generated until it has again passed the position where the reversal started.

EnumEntry.Name: Motion
EnumEntry.Description: The triggers are generated for all motion increments in either direction.

Integer.Name: rotaryEncoderMultiplier
Integer.Description: Specifies a multiplication factor for the rotary encoder output pulse generator.

Integer.Name: rotaryEncoderDivider
Integer.Description: Specifies a division factor for the rotary encoder output pulse generator.

Enumeration.Name: rotaryEncoderRescalerOrder
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the order that the multiplier and divider are applied.

EnumEntry.Name: multiplierDivider
EnumEntry.Description: The signal is multiplied before been divided.

EnumEntry.Name: dividerMultiplier
EnumEntry.Description: The signal is divided before been multiplied.

Enumeration.Name: rotaryEncoderSrcActivation
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the signal edge(s) use to increment the rotary encoder.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: The rotary encoder uses the rising edge of the source signal.

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Rotary encoder uses falling or rising edges.
EnumEntry.Description: The rotary encoder uses either the rising edge or falling edge of the source signal.

Enumeration.Name: rotaryEncoderDirection
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the phase which defines the encoder forward direction.

EnumEntry.Name: Clockwise
EnumEntry.Description: Inspection goes forward when the rotary encoder direction is clockwise (phase B is ahead of phase A).

EnumEntry.Name: CounterClockwise
EnumEntry.Description: Inspection goes forward when the rotary encoder direction is counter clockwise (phase A is ahead of phase B).

Enumeration.Name: rotaryEncoderInputASource
Enumeration.Description: Selects which input line to assign to the rotary encoder input A (also known as shaft encoder). Note that the Line Mode feature must be set to Input. The list of supported input line sources is device-specific.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Rotary Encoder Input A from line1
EnumEntry.Description: Line1 is assigned to the Rotary Encoder Input A

EnumEntry.Name: Line3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Rotary Encoder Input A from line3
EnumEntry.Description: Line3 is assigned to the Rotary Encoder Input A

Enumeration.Name: rotaryEncoderInputBSource
Enumeration.Description: Selects which input line to assign to the rotary encoder input B (also known as shaft encoder). Note that the Line Mode feature must be set to Input. The list of supported input line sources is device-specific.

EnumEntry.Name: GND
EnumEntry.Description: Rotary Encoder Input B is not used

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Rotary Encoder Input B from line2
EnumEntry.Description: Line2 is assigned to the Rotary Encoder Input B

EnumEntry.Name: Line4
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Rotary Encoder Input B from line4
EnumEntry.Description: Line4 is assigned to the Rotary Encoder Input B

Enumeration.Name: LineSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the physical line (or pin) of the external device connector to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Line3
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Line4
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Line5
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Line6
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to configure.

Enumeration.Name: LineFormat
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specify the current electrical format of the selected physical input or output.
Enumeration.Description: Specify the current electrical format of the selected physical input or output.

EnumEntry.Name: RS422
EnumEntry.Description: The line accepts or sends RS422 level signals.

EnumEntry.Name: SingleEnded
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The line is configured as single ended.
EnumEntry.Description: The line is single ended input for 3.3V/5V/12V/24V or output for 3.3V LVTTL.

EnumEntry.Name: OpenCollector
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The line is output as open collector.
EnumEntry.Description: The line is output as open collector.

Enumeration.Name: lineDetectionLevel
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the voltage threshold required to recognize a signal transition on an input line.

EnumEntry.Name: Threshold_for_3V3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Valid detection range under 0.8 Volt and over 2.4 Volt
EnumEntry.Description: A signal below 0.8V will be detected as a Logical LOW and a signal greater then 2.4V will be detected as a Logical HIGH on the selected input line.

EnumEntry.Name: Threshold_for_5V
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Valid detection range under 0.8 Volt and over 2.4 Volt
EnumEntry.Description: A signal below 0.8V will be detected as a Logical LOW and a signal greater then 2.4V will be detected as a Logical HIGH on the selected input line.

EnumEntry.Name: Threshold_for_12V
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Valid detection range under 2.0 Volt and over 10 Volt
EnumEntry.Description: A signal below 2.0V will be detected as a Logical LOW and a signal greater then 10V will be detected as a Logical HIGH on the selected input line.

EnumEntry.Name: Threshold_for_24V
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Valid detection range under 4.0 Volt and over 20 Volt
EnumEntry.Description: A signal below 4.0V will be detected as a Logical LOW and a signal greater then 20V will be detected as a Logical HIGH on the selected input line.

Enumeration.Name: LineMode
Enumeration.Description: Reports if the physical Line is an Input or Output signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Input
EnumEntry.Description: The line is an input line.

EnumEntry.Name: Output
EnumEntry.Description: The line is an output line.

Boolean.Name: LineStatus
Boolean.Description: Returns the current status of the selected input or output line.

Boolean.Name: LineInverter
Boolean.ToolTip: Set the polarity of the line
Boolean.Description: Controls whether to invert the polarity of the selected input or output line signal.

Integer.Name: lineDebouncingPeriod
Integer.ToolTip: Debouncing Period of the Input Line
Integer.Description: Specifies the minimum delay before an input line voltage transition is recognizing as a signal transition.

Enumeration.Name: lineElectricalTermination
Enumeration.ToolTip: Electrical line termination enable or disabled.
Enumeration.Description: Controls if the electrical termination of the selected line is enabled of disabled.

EnumEntry.Name: Disabled
EnumEntry.Description: Disabled electrical line termination for the selected line.

EnumEntry.Name: Enabled
EnumEntry.Description: Enabled electrical line termination for the selected line.

Enumeration.Name: outputLineSource
Enumeration.Description: Selects which internal signal or event driven pulse or software control state to output on the selected output line. Note, the LineMode feature must be set to Output.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Line output is Open

EnumEntry.Name: SoftwareControlled
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The OutputLineValue feature changes the state of the output.
EnumEntry.Description: The OutputLineValue feature changes the state of the output.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofFrame
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the start of the Frame Active.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofLine
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the start of the Line Active.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofExposure
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ExposureStart event. This option is typically used to trigger a strobe light.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnEndofExposure
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ExposureEnd event. This option is typically used to trigger a strobe light.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofReadout
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ReadoutStart event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnEndofReadout
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ReadoutEnd event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnValidLineTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the LineTrigger event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInvalidLineTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Invalid LineTrigger event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofAcquisition
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse when the AcquisiontStart event occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnEndofAcquisition
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse when the AcquisiontStop event occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnTimer1End
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the TimerEnd 1 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnTimer2End
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the TimerEnd 2 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnCounter1End
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the CounterEnd 1 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnCounter2End
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the CounterEnd 2 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInput1
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input signal 1 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInput2
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input signal 2 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInput3
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input signal 3 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInput4
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input signal 4 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnRotaryEncoder1
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Rotary Encoder 1 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnSoftwareCmd
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input of a Software Command.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameTriggerActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the Frame trigger is active.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the Frame valid is active.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the Exposure is active.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadoutActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the line valid is active.

EnumEntry.Name: SmartStrobeActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the Readout or the ExposureDelay are active. The smart strobe only works when triggerLineCount is greater than 1.

Enumeration.Name: outputLinePulseActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the input line activation mode to trigger the OutputLine pulse.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the input line activation mode to trigger the OutputLine pulse.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal.-

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.-

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Trigger valid on falling or rising edge.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling or rising edge of the source signal.

Integer.Name: outputLinePulseDelay
Integer.Description: Sets the delay before the output line pulse duration signal. Applicable for the OutputLineSource feature. Note, the LineMode feature must be set to output.

Integer.Name: outputLinePulseDuration
Integer.Description: Sets the width (duration) of the output line pulse in microseconds.

Enumeration.Name: outputLineSoftwareLatchControl
Enumeration.Description: When Off, the selected output line is set with the value in Output Line Value.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Output pin state set by outputLineValue.

EnumEntry.Name: Latch
EnumEntry.Description: Output pin state set by outputLineSoftwareCmd.

Enumeration.Name: outputLineValue
Enumeration.Description: Sets the output state of the selected Line if the outputLineSoftwareLatchControl = OFF. OutputLineSource must be SoftwareControlled. If the outputLineSoftwareLatchControl = Latch , the state of the pin will change with the outputLineSoftwareCmd command.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the Output circuit to close

EnumEntry.Name: Inactive
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the Output circuit to open

Integer.Name: LineStatusAll
Integer.Description: Returns the current status of all available line signals, at time of polling, in a single bitfield. The order is Line1, Line2, ...

Integer.Name: outputLineSoftwareCmd
Integer.Description: Writing a value of 1 in the bit field applies the Latch value of the outputLineSoftwareLatchControl and/or executes the PulseOnSoftwareCmd for any output line programmed for software control. The feature outputLineSoftwareCmd can take any binary value and each bit set to 1 corresponds to a Icommand for an Output. Note that Outputs are numbered from 1 to N, therefore Bit 1 of outputLineSoftwareCmd corresponds to Output1. This is applicable to OutputLineSource = Pulse On: where Software Cmd (for Pulse mode) or OutputLineSource = SoftwareControlled and OutputLineSoftwareLatchControl = Latch (for static states).

Enumeration.Name: balanceWhiteROIMode
Enumeration.Description: When active, the White Balance algorithm limits analysis to the ROI image area to determine the white balance adjustments.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: All of the output image is used in the White Balance algorithm
EnumEntry.Description: All of the output image is used in the White Balance algorithm.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The selected ROI is used in the White Balance algorithm
EnumEntry.Description: The selected ROI is used in the White Balance algorithm.

Enumeration.Description: Controls the mode for automatic white balancing between the color channels. The color gains are automatically adjusted.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: White balancing is manually controlled using BalanceRatio[Red], BalanceRatio[Green] and BalanceRatio[Blue].

EnumEntry.Name: OnDemand
EnumEntry.Description: White balancing is automatically adjusted once by the device.

Command.Name: balanceWhiteAutoOnDemandCmd
Command.ToolTip: Executes the automatic white balance function.
Command.Description: Executes the automatic white balance function. The first frame acquired is used to calculate the RGB gain adjustments, which are then applied to subsequent snaps or grabs.

Integer.Description: Specifies the offset x, in pixels, of the white balance processing ROI.

Integer.Name: balanceWhiteROIWidth
Integer.Description: Specifies the width, in pixels, of the white balance processing ROI.

Integer.Name: processingPathBppMax
Integer.Description: Maximum bits per pixel for the camera processing path.
Integer.DisplayName: Processing path max bits per pixel

Enumeration.Name: flatfieldCorrectionMode
Enumeration.Description: Sets the mode for the Flat Field correction.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Flat Field Correction is disabled.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.Description: Flat Field Correction is enabled.

EnumEntry.Name: Calibration
EnumEntry.Description: When selected, the camera is configured for flat field correction calibration. The device may automatically adjust some of its features when calibrate mode is enabled. The features that are automatically adjusted are device specific. The device will not restore these features when the Flat Field Correction Mode feature is changed from Calibrate mode to another mode.

Enumeration.Name: flatfieldCorrectionCurrentActiveSet
Enumeration.ToolTip: Flat Field Correction Current Active Set
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the current set of Flat Field coefficients to use.
Enumeration.DisplayName: Flat Field Correction Current Active Set

EnumEntry.Name: FactoryFlatfield
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the factory Flat Field coefficient table as the current Flat Field.

EnumEntry.Name: UserFlatfield1
EnumEntry.Description: Sets User Flat Field 1 coefficient table as the current Flat Field.

EnumEntry.Name: UserFlatfield2
EnumEntry.Description: Sets User Flat Field 2 coefficient table as the current Flat Field.

EnumEntry.Name: UserFlatfield3
EnumEntry.Description: Sets User Flat Field 3 coefficient table as the current Flat Field.

EnumEntry.Name: UserFlatfield4
EnumEntry.Description: Sets User Flat Field 4 coefficient table as the current Flat Field.

Enumeration.Name: flatfieldCorrectionType
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the Flat Field correction type.

EnumEntry.Name: LineBase
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Flat field correction on individual line.
EnumEntry.Description: Flat field correction is based on an individual line (FlatLine).

Enumeration.Name: flatfieldCorrectionAlgorithm
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the Flat Field correction algorithm to use.

EnumEntry.Name: Method1
EnumEntry.Description: The following formula is used to calculate the flat field corrected pixel: newPixelValue[x] = (sensorPixelValue[x] - FFCOffset[x]) * FFCGain[x]

Enumeration.Name: flatfieldCorrectionCalibrationAlgorithm
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the flatfield calibration algorithm to use.

EnumEntry.Name: Basic
EnumEntry.Description: Direct calculation of coefficients based on average line values and target.

EnumEntry.Name: LowPass
EnumEntry.Description: Apply a low pass filter to average line prior to calculating coefficients. Used when target is not uniformly white or it is not possible to defocus image.

Integer.Name: flatfieldCalibrationTarget
Integer.Description: Sets the target pixel value for the gain (PRNU) calibration.

Enumeration.Name: flatfieldCalibrationSampleSize
Enumeration.Description: Set flat field calibration sample size (number of lines to sum)

Integer.Name: flatfieldCalibrationROIOffsetX
Integer.Description: Sets the ROI Offset X.

Integer.Name: flatfieldCalibrationROIWidth
Integer.Description: Sets the ROI Width.

Command.Name: flatfieldCalibrationFPN
Command.Description: Performs Fixed Pattern Noise (FPN) calibration by reducing to zero dark pixel current using a pixel offset.

EnumEntry.Name: NoError
EnumEntry.Description: No Error

EnumEntry.Name: GenericError
EnumEntry.Description: FPN calibration failed.

EnumEntry.Name: BusyError
EnumEntry.Description: Camera Busy
EnumEntry.DisplayName: The camera is busy and cannot perform the FPN calibration.

EnumEntry.Name: TimeoutError
EnumEntry.Description: Timeout Error
EnumEntry.DisplayName: The FPN calibration did not finished on time.

EnumEntry.Name: MemoryError
EnumEntry.Description: Memory Error
EnumEntry.DisplayName: The camera cannot allocate the memory needed for FPN calibration.

EnumEntry.Name: TargetError
EnumEntry.DisplayName: The FPN calibration was not able to reach the targets.

Command.Name: flatfieldCalibrationPRNU
Command.Description: Performs Photo Response Non Uniformity (PRNU) calibration to a targeted, user-defined value. PRNU calibration eliminates the difference in responsivity between the most and least sensitive pixel, creating a uniform response to light.

EnumEntry.Name: NoError
EnumEntry.Description: No Error

EnumEntry.Name: GenericError
EnumEntry.Description: FPN calibration failed.

EnumEntry.Name: BusyError
EnumEntry.Description: Camera Busy
EnumEntry.DisplayName: The camera is busy and cannot perform the FPN calibration.

EnumEntry.Name: TimeoutError
EnumEntry.Description: Timeout Error
EnumEntry.DisplayName: The FPN calibration did not finished on time.

EnumEntry.Name: MemoryError
EnumEntry.Description: Memory Error
EnumEntry.DisplayName: The camera cannot allocate the memory needed for FPN calibration.

EnumEntry.Name: TargetError
EnumEntry.DisplayName: The PRNU calibration was not able to reach the targets.

Command.Name: flatfieldCalibrationSave
Command.Description: Save the calibration performed by flatfieldCalibrationFPN and flatfieldCalibrationPRNU to the active set.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureDelay

EnumEntry.Name: Gain

EnumEntry.Name: FlatFieldCorrection

EnumEntry.Name: BlackLevel

Enumeration.Name: cP_FeaturesActivationMode
Enumeration.Description: Enables the selected feature to be part of the cycling. When activating the selected feature, this will automatically set the corresponding standard camera feature to read only.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Exclude the selected feature from cycling
EnumEntry.Description: Exclude the selected feature from the cycling.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Activate the selected feature in the cycling
EnumEntry.Description: Include the selected feature in the cycling.

Integer.Name: cP_PresetConfigurationSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects the cycling preset to configure
Integer.Description: Selects the cycling preset to configure.

Float.Name: cP_ExposureTime
Float.Description: Sets the exposure time (in microseconds) for the selected set.

Float.Name: cP_Gain
Float.Description: Sets the selected gain as an amplification factor applied to the image.

Enumeration.Name: cP_flatfieldCorrectionCurrentActiveSet

EnumEntry.Name: UserFlatfield3

EnumEntry.Name: UserFlatfield4

Enumeration.Name: cP_LineSelector

EnumEntry.Name: Line3
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to use.

EnumEntry.Name: Line4
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to use.

EnumEntry.Name: Line5
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to use.

EnumEntry.Name: Line6
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to use.

Enumeration.Name: cP_OutputLineSource
Enumeration.Description: Selects which internal signal, or event driven pulse, or software control state to output on the selected output line.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Line output is Open

EnumEntry.Name: SoftwareControlled
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The OutputLineValue feature changes the state of the output.
EnumEntry.Description: The OutputLineValue feature changes the state of the output.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofFrame
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the start of the Frame Active.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofLine
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the start of the Line Active.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofExposure
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ExposureStart event. This option is typically used to trigger a strobe light.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnEndofExposure
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ExposureEnd event. This option is typically used to trigger a strobe light.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofReadout
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ReadoutStart event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnEndofReadout
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ReadoutEnd event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnValidLineTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the LineTrigger event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInvalidLineTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Invalid LineTrigger event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofAcquisition
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse when the AcquisitionStart event occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnEndofAcquisition
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse when the AcquisitionStop event occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnTimer1End
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the TimerEnd 1 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnTimer2End
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the TimerEnd 2 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnCounter1End
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the CounterEnd 1 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnCounter2End
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the CounterEnd 2 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInput1
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input signal 1 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInput2
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input signal 2 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInput3
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input signal 3 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInput4
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input signal 4 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnRotaryEncoder1
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Rotary Encoder 1 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnSoftwareCmd
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input of a Software Command

EnumEntry.Name: FrameTriggerActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the Frame trigger is active.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the Frame valid is active.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the Exposure is active.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadoutActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the line valid is active.

EnumEntry.Name: SmartStrobeActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the Readout or the ExposureDelay are active. The smart strobe only works when triggerLineCount is greater than 1.

Enumeration.Name: cP_OutputLineValue
Enumeration.Description: Sets the output state of the selected Line if the outputLineSoftwareLatchControl = OFF. OutputLineSource must be SoftwareControlled. If the outputLineSoftwareLatchControl = Latch , the state of the pin will change with the outputLineSoftwareCmd command.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the Output circuit to closed.

EnumEntry.Name: Inactive
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the Output circuit to open.

Float.Name: cP_ExposureDelay
Float.Description: Sets the exposure delay (in microseconds) for the selected set.

Category.Name: ImageFormatControl
Category.ToolTip: Features controlling the size of the transmitted image

Enumeration.Name: PixelColorFilter
Enumeration.ToolTip: Color filter convention of the image
Enumeration.Description: Indicates the type of color filter applied to the image.

EnumEntry.Name: None
EnumEntry.Description: No filter applied

EnumEntry.Name: CFA1b4_GRBG
EnumEntry.Description: CFA1b4_GRBG filter applied

Enumeration.Name: ColorInterpolationAlgorithm
Enumeration.Description: Color Interpolation Algorithm

Integer.Name: WidthMax
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum width (in pixels) of the image
Integer.Description: The maximum image width is the dimension calculated after horizontal binning, decimation or any other function changing the horizontal dimension of the image.

Integer.Name: HeightMax
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum height (in pixels) of the image
Integer.Description: The maximum image height is the dimension calculated after vertical binning, decimation or any other function changing the vertical dimension of the image.

Integer.Name: Width

Integer.Name: OffsetX

Integer.Name: Height
Integer.Description: Height of the Image provided by the device (in lines).

IntReg.Name: pHeightReg

Enumeration.Description: Format of the pixel provided by the device. Contains all information as provided by PixelCoding, PixelSize, PixelColorFilter, combined in one single value.

EnumEntry.Name: Mono8

EnumEntry.Name: Mono12
EnumEntry.Description: Mono12: Monochrome 12-Bit

EnumEntry.Name: Mono12Packed
EnumEntry.Description: Mono12: Monochrome 12-Bit Packed

EnumEntry.Name: BGRa8

EnumEntry.Name: G8

EnumEntry.Name: BiColorRGBG12p

EnumEntry.Name: RGB8

EnumEntry.Name: Bpp10

EnumEntry.Name: MonoSigned

EnumEntry.Name: MonoPacked

EnumEntry.Name: RGBPacked

EnumEntry.Name: YUV422Packed

Enumeration.Name: endOfLineMetadataMode
Enumeration.Description: Sets the enable state of the End-of-Line Metadata Mode. End-of-Line Metadata allows the inclusion of line statistics such as the average pixel value or peak value with the readout of each line.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Disabled the End-of-Line Metadata generation.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.Description: Enable the End-of-Line Metadata generation.

Enumeration.Name: endOfLineMetadataContentSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the content of the End-of-Line Metadata to control. Each element is part of a QWORD (8 bytes). Enabling a single element in a QWORD will result on sending the complete QWORD on each line.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureTime
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of exposure in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 1.

EnumEntry.Name: cyclingPresetCurrentActiveSet
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Cycling preset current active set present
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the cycling preset current active set in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 1.

EnumEntry.Name: flatfieldCorrectionCurrentActiveSet
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Flat field correction current active set present
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the flat field correction current active set in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 1.
EnumEntry.DisplayName: Flat Field Correction Current Active Set

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalGain
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the digital gain in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 1.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalOffset
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the digital offset in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 1.

EnumEntry.Name: LineStatusAll
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of all line status in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 1.

EnumEntry.Name: LineCounter
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the line counter in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 2.

EnumEntry.Name: LineTriggerCounter
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the line trigger counter in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 2.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1Status
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the timer1 status in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 2.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer2Status
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the timer2 status in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 2.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1Status
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the counter1 status in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 2.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter2Status
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the counter2 status in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 2.

EnumEntry.Name: Timestamp
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the timestamp in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 3.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1Value
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the timer1 value in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 4.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer2Value
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the timer2 value in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 5.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1Value
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the Counter1 value in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 4.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter2Value
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the Counter2 value in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 5.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameCounter
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the Frame counter in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 6.

EnumEntry.Name: CameraID
EnumEntry.Description: Control the presence of the Camera ID in the End-of-Line Metadata. This element is part of QWORD 6.

Enumeration.Name: endOfLineMetadataContentActivationMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Activate the selected the End-of-Line Metadata element
Enumeration.Description: Control if the selected element is part of the End-of-Line Metadata.

EnumEntry.Name: False
EnumEntry.Description: The selected element is not part of the End-of-Line Metadata.

EnumEntry.Name: True
EnumEntry.Description: The selected element is part of the End-of-Line Metadata.

Command.Name: endofLineMetadataResetFrameCount
Command.ToolTip: Reset the frame count in metadata
Command.Description: Reset the frame count in metadata.

Integer.Name: endOfLineMetadataPixelCount
Integer.ToolTip: Number of pixel in the End-of-Line Metadata
Integer.Description: Returns the number of pixel(s) that contains End-of-Line Metadata information.

Enumeration.Name: TestPattern
Enumeration.Description: Selects the type of test image output by the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Image is from the camera sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyHorizontalRamp
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled horizontally with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyVerticalRamp
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled vertically with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest.

EnumEntry.Name: DarkGray
EnumEntry.Description: 2746/1381 pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: FlatGray
EnumEntry.Description: 0x565 test pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: FlatDark
EnumEntry.Description: 0x20 test pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyHorizontalRamp2
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled horizontally with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest. Similar to GreyHorizontalRamp pattern except a small shift in each pixel.

Enumeration.Name: TestImageSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the type of test image that is sent by the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Image is from the camera sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyHorizontalRamp
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled horizontally with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyVerticalRamp
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled vertically with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest.

EnumEntry.Name: DarkGray
EnumEntry.Description: 2746/1381 pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: FlatGray
EnumEntry.Description: 0x565 test pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: FlatDark
EnumEntry.Description: 0x20 test pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyHorizontalRamp2
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled horizontally with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest. Similar to GreyHorizontalRamp pattern except a small shift in each pixel.

Enumeration.Name: multipleROIMode
Enumeration.Description: Enable the Multiple ROI (Region of Interest) per image feature. The ROI Count is set by the Multiple ROI Count feature.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Single ROI per image.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.Description: The ROI per image feature is active.

Integer.Name: multipleROICountHorizontal
Integer.Description: Specifies the number of ROI (Region of Interest) available for the X axis.

Enumeration.Name: multipleROISelector
Enumeration.Description: Select an ROI (Region of Interest) when Multiple ROI Mode is enabled. Selector range is from 1 to the Multiple ROI Count value.

EnumEntry.Name: roi1_1
EnumEntry.Description: ROI (x1, y1)

EnumEntry.Name: roi2_1
EnumEntry.Description: ROI (x2, y1)

EnumEntry.Name: roi3_1
EnumEntry.Description: ROI (x3, y1)

EnumEntry.Name: roi4_1
EnumEntry.Description: ROI (x4, y1)

Integer.Name: multipleROIWidth
Integer.Description: Width of the selected ROI (Region of Interest) provided by the device (in pixels). Increment value is device dependent.

Integer.Name: multipleROIOffsetX
Integer.Description: Horizontal offset (in pixels) from the origin to the selected ROI (Region of Interest).

Boolean.Name: ReverseX
Boolean.Description: Horizontal image flip function.

Boolean.Name: NegativeImage
Boolean.ToolTip: Invert the pixel brightness to get negative image.
Boolean.Description: Invert the pixel brightness to get negative image.

Enumeration.Name: binningSelector
Enumeration.Description: Select how the Horizontal and Vertical Binning is done. The Binning function can occur in the Digital domain of a device or at the actual sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: InSensor
EnumEntry.Description: The Binning function can be done inside the Sensor itself, which often allows binning to increase the data rate from the sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: InDigitalDomain
EnumEntry.Description: The Binning function can be done inside the device but with a digital processing function. Binning doesn’t affect the current data rate from the sensor or camera.

Integer.Name: BinningHorizontal
Integer.Description: Number of horizontal photo-sensitive cells to combine together. This increases the intensity of the pixels but reduces the horizontal resolution of the image.

Integer.Name: BinningVertical
Integer.Description: Number of vertical photo-sensitive cells to combine together. This increases the intensity of the pixels but reduces the vertical resolution of the image.

Enumeration.Name: BinningVerticalMode
Enumeration.Description: Sets the mode used to combine vertical photo-sensitive cells together when Binning Vertical is used.

EnumEntry.Name: Sum
EnumEntry.Description: The response from the combined cells will be added, resulting in increased sensitivity.

EnumEntry.Name: Average
EnumEntry.Description: The response from the combines cells will be averaged, resulting in increase signal to noise ratio.

Enumeration.Name: BinningAverageMode
Enumeration.Description: Sum the pixel value and then take average. This increases the effective of full well.

EnumEntry.Name: False
EnumEntry.Description: Pixel value is the summation of binning pixels.

EnumEntry.Name: True
EnumEntry.Description: Pixel value is the average of binning pixels.

Category.Name: acquisitionTransferControl
Category.ToolTip: Category of features related to actual image acquisition and transfer.

Enumeration.Name: AcquisitionStatusSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the internal acquisition signal to read using AcquisitionStatus.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionTriggerWait
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently waiting for a trigger to capture one or more frames.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionActive
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently doing an acquisition of one or more frames.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionTransfer
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently transferring an acquisition of one or more frames.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameTriggerWait
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently waiting for a frame trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameActive
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently capturing a frame.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameTransfer
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently transferring a frame.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureActive
EnumEntry.Description: Device is exposing a frame.

Boolean.Name: AcquisitionStatus
Boolean.Description: Reads the state of the internal acquisition signal selected using the AcquisitionStatusSelector feature.

Enumeration.Name: AcquisitionMode
Enumeration.Description: Set the acquisition mode of the device. It defines the number of frames to capture during an acquisition and the way the acquisition stops.

EnumEntry.Name: SingleFrame
EnumEntry.Description: One frame is captured for each AcquisitionStart Command. An AcquisitionStop occurs at the end of the Active Frame.

EnumEntry.Name: MultiFrame
EnumEntry.Description: A sequence of frames is captured for each AcquisitionStart Command. The number of frames is specified by AcquisitionFrameCount feature. An AcquisitionStop occurs at the end of the Active Frame(s).

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.Description: Frames are captured continuously with AcquisitionStart until stopped with the AcquisitionStop command.

Boolean.Name: AcquisitionStopAtLineEnd
Boolean.Description: Set the acquisition stop boundary of the device. It defines the acquisition stops at line boundary or not.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStart
Command.ToolTip: Start image capture using currently selected acquisition mode
Command.Description: Starts the Acquisition of the device. The number of frames captured is specified by AcquisitionMode feature.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStop
Command.Description: Stops the Acquisition of the device at the end of the current frame unless the triggerFrameCount feature is greater then 1.

Command.Name: AcquisitionAbort
Command.Description: Aborts the acquisition immediately. This will end the capture without completing the current frame or aborts waiting on a trigger. If no acquisition is in progress, the command is ignored.

Command.Name: AcquisitionArm
Command.Description: Arms the device before an AcquisitionStart command. This optional command validates all the current features for consistency and prepares the device for a fast start of the acquisition. If not used explicitly, this command is automatically executed at the first AcquisitionStart but will not be repeated for subsequent ones unless a data transfer related feature is changed in the device.

Integer.Name: AcquisitionFrameCount
Integer.Description: Number of frames to be acquired in MultiFrame acquisition mode.

Integer.Name: AcquisitionBurstFrameCount
Integer.ToolTip: Number of frames to acquire for each FrameBurst trigger
Integer.Description: Sets the maximum number of frames to acquire when a valid trigger is received. This feature is available when the Trigger Selector is set to Burst Trigger.

Command.Name: DeviceRegistersStreamingStart
Command.Description: Announces the start of registers streaming without immediate checking for consistency.

Command.Name: DeviceRegistersStreamingEnd
Command.Description: Announces end of registers streaming and performs validation for registers consistency before activating them.

Command.Name: DeviceFeaturePersistenceStart
Command.Description: Announces the start of feature streaming without immediate checking for consistency.

Command.Name: DeviceFeaturePersistenceEnd
Command.Description: Announces end of feature streaming and performs validation for feature consistency before activating them.

Command.Name: DeviceRegistersCheck
Command.Description: Performs an explicit register set validation for consistency.

Boolean.Name: DeviceRegistersValid
Boolean.Description: States if the current register set is valid and consistent.

Enumeration.Name: TransferControlMode
Enumeration.Description: Sets the method used to control the transfer.

EnumEntry.Name: Basic
EnumEntry.Description: Basic mode ensures maximum compatibility but does not allow for control of the transfer flow.

EnumEntry.Name: UserControlled
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Transfer flow is controlled by the user
EnumEntry.Description: Manual mode allows maximum control of the transfer flow.

Enumeration.Name: TransferOperationMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the operation mode of the transfer
Enumeration.Description: Sets the operation mode of the transfer.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.Description: Blocks are transferred continuously until stopped with the TransferStop command.

EnumEntry.Name: MultiBlock
EnumEntry.Description: The transfer terminates after the transition on TransferBlockCount or before on a user request.

Integer.Name: TransferBlockCount
Integer.Description: Specifies the number of Data Blocks the device must stream during the next transfer.

IntReg.Name: transferQueueCurrentBlockCount
IntReg.Description: Returns the current number of blocks in the transfer queue.

Command.Name: TransferStart
Command.Description: Starts the streaming of data Block(s)to another device.

Command.Name: TransferStop
Command.Description: Stops the streaming of data Block(s)to another device.

Command.Name: TransferAbort
Command.Description: Aborts the streaming of data Block(s)to another device.

Category.Name: deviceEventControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the camera Event related features.

Enumeration.Name: timestampSource
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the source used as the incrementing signal for the Timestamp register.

EnumEntry.Name: InternalClock
EnumEntry.Description: The timestamp source is generated by the camera internal clock. Refer to the timestampTickFrequency feature for the time base.

Integer.Name: timestampValue
Integer.Description: Returns the 64-bit value of the timestamp counter.

Integer.Name: GevTimestampValue
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the 64-bit value of the timestamp counter.
Integer.Description: Returns the 64-bit value of the timestamp counter.

IntReg.Name: BootStrap_GevTimestampValueLatchedHigh
IntReg.Description: Current Gev Timestamp Value Latched High Register

IntReg.Name: BootStrap_GevTimestampValueLatchedLow
IntReg.Description: Current Gev Timestamp Value Latched Low Register

Command.Name: timestampControlReset
Command.Description: Resets the timestamp counter to 0.

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlReset
Command.Description: same as timestampControlReset

Command.Name: timestampControlLatch
Command.Description: Latch the current timestamp internal counter value in the timestampValue feature.

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlLatch
Command.Description: same as timestampControlLatch

Integer.Name: timestampTickFrequency
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of timestamp ticks (or increments) during 1 second (frequency in Hz).

Integer.Name: GevTimestampTickFrequency
Integer.Description: same as timestampTickFrequency

IntReg.Name: BootStrap_GevtimestampTickFrequencyHigh
IntReg.Description: Current Gev Timestamp Tick Frequency High Register

IntReg.Name: BootStrap_GevtimestampTickFrequencyLow
IntReg.Description: Current Gev Timestamp Tick Frequency Low Register

Category.Name: EventControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the camera Event related features.

Enumeration.Name: EventSelector
Enumeration.Description: Select the Event to enable/disable with the EventNotification feature.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionStart
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel on acquisition start.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel on acquisition end.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel on an Active Frame. This occurs with the start of the exposure delay.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel on an Active Frame end.

EnumEntry.Name: ValidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a valid frame trigger is generated.

EnumEntry.Name: InvalidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a frame trigger occurs in an invalid Trigger region. Therefore the trigger is rejected and no frame acquisition occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameTriggerDelayerOverflow
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a frame trigger cannot be delay because the frame trigger delayer is already delaying its maximum number of frame trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: ImageLost
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when an image is lost due to insufficient memory.

EnumEntry.Name: InvalidLineTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a line trigger occurs in an invalid Trigger region. Therefore the trigger is rejected and no frame acquisition occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: LineTriggerOverlap
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a line trigger occurs in an invalid trigger region and was delayed by the camera into a valid region.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent to indicate line 1 changes
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a state change occurs on line 1.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent to indicate line 2 changes
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a state change occurs on line 2.

EnumEntry.Name: Line3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent to indicate line 3 changes
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a state change occurs on line 3.

EnumEntry.Name: Line4
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent to indicate line 4 changes
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a state change occurs on line 4.

EnumEntry.Name: Line3PulseStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent to indicate a pulse on line 3
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a pulse is generated on line 3.

EnumEntry.Name: Line4PulseStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent to indicate a pulse on line 4
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a pulse is generated on line 4.

EnumEntry.Name: Line5PulseStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent to indicate a pulse on line 5
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a pulse is generated on line 5.

EnumEntry.Name: Line6PulseStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent to indicate a pulse on line 6
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a pulse is generated on line 6.

EnumEntry.Name: eventsOverflow
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent to indicate that all events have been disabled because the camera cannot send them fast enough.
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when all previous active events have been disabled because the camera cannot send them fast enough, generating an internal message overflow. All required events must be re-enabled manually.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionStart
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel on acquisition start.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel on acquisition end.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel on an Active Frame. This occurs with the start of the exposure delay.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel on an Active Frame end.

EnumEntry.Name: ValidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a valid frame trigger is generated.

EnumEntry.Name: InvalidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a frame trigger occurs in an invalid Trigger region. Therefore the trigger is rejected and no frame acquisition occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameTriggerDelayerOverflow
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a frame trigger cannot be delay because the frame trigger delayer is already delaying its maximum number of frame trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: ImageLost
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when an image is lost due to insufficient memory.

EnumEntry.Name: InvalidLineTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a line trigger occurs in an invalid Trigger region. Therefore the trigger is rejected and no frame acquisition occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: LineTriggerOverlap
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a line trigger occurs in an invalid trigger region and was delayed by the camera into a valid region.

EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a state change occurs on line 1.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedIPConfigurationLLA
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicates if LLA mode is supported
Boolean.Description: Indicates if LLA (Auto-IP) is supported by the selected interface. The LLA method automatically assigns the camera with a randomly chosen address on the 169.254.xxx.xxx subnet. After an address is chosen, the link-local process sends an ARP query with that IP onto the network to see if it is already in use. If there is no response, the IP is assigned to the device, otherwise another IP is selected, and the ARP is repeated. Note that LLA is unable to forward packets across routers. LLA is the recommended scheme when only one NIC is connected to GigE cameras; ensure only one NIC is using LLA on your PC, otherwise IP conflicts will result.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedIPConfigurationDHCP
Boolean.Description: Indicates if DHCP is supported by the selected interface. This IP configuration mode requires a DHCP server to allocate an IP address dynamically over the range of some defined subnet. The camera must be configured to have DHCP enabled. This is the factory default settings. The DHCP server is part of a managed network. Windows itself does not provide a DHCP server function therefore a dedicated DHCP server is required. The DALSA Network Configuration Tool can be configured as a DHCP server on the NIC used for the GigE Vision network.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedIPConfigurationPersistentIP
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicates if Persistent IP is supported
Boolean.Description: Indicates if Persistent IP is supported by the selected interface. This protocol is only suggested if the user fully controls the assignment of IP addresses on the network and a GigE Vision camera is connected beyond routers. The GigE Vision camera is forced a static IP address. The NIC IP address must use the same subnet otherwise the camera is not accessible. If the camera is connected to a network with a different subnet, it cannot be accessed.
